item.title: Cody add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "When you start to live outside yourself, it's all dangerous." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Cody add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "Happiness in intelligent people is the rarest thing I know." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Cody add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "In the middle of difficulty lies opportunity" -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Cody add a quote by Blaise Pascal
item.description: "The last act is bloody, however fine the rest of the play" -- Blaise Pascal

item.title: Cody add a quote by Blaise Pascal
item.description: "The heart has its reasons which reason knows not." -- Blaise Pascal

item.title: Cody add a quote by Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
item.description: "Resolve and thou art free" -- Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

item.title: Cody add a quote by Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
item.description: "Music is the universal language of mankind." -- Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

item.title: Cody add a quote by Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
item.description: "Talk not of wasted affection; affection never was wasted." -- Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

item.title: Cody add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "You can't measure the mutual affection of two human beings by the number of words they exchange." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Cody add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "Two people in love, alone, isolated from the world, that's beautiful." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Cody add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "I exist as I am, that is enough, If no other in the world be aware I sit content, And if each and all be aware I sit content. One world is aware, and by the far the largest to me, and that is myself, And whether I come to my own today or in ten thousand or ten million years, I can cheerfully take it now, or with equal cheerfulness, I can wait." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Cody add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Cody add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Cody add a quote by Gordon A. Eadie
item.description: "If you don't stand for something you will fall for anything." -- Gordon A. Eadie

item.title: Cody add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Our lives begin to end the day we become silent about things that matter." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Cody add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Cody add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Cody add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Cody add a quote by Lao-Tzu
item.description: "By letting go it all gets done." -- Lao-Tzu

item.title: Cody add a quote by Bhagavan Das
item.description: "It always comes back to just letting go with love. Just put the love in it. Whatever it is, and if you can't put love in it, don't do it!" -- Bhagavan Das

item.title: Cody add a quote by John Wayne
item.description: "Courage is being scared to death, but saddling up anyway." -- John Wayne

item.title: Cody add a quote by Marianne Williamson
item.description: "Love is what we are born with. Fear is what we learn. The spiritual journey is the unlearning of fear and prejudices and the acceptance of love back in our hearts. Love is the essential reality and our purpose on earth. To be consciously aware of it, to experience love in ourselves and others, is the meaning of life. Meaning does not lie in things. Meaning lies in us." -- Marianne Williamson

item.title: Cody add a quote by Jane Fonda
item.description: "A good many dramatic situations begin with screaming." -- Jane Fonda

item.title: Cody add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "The question isn't who is going to let me; it's who is going to stop me." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Cody add a quote by Gilda Radner
item.description: "While we have the gift of life, it seems to me that only tragedy is to allow part of us to dieâ€”whether it is our spirit, our creativity, or our glorious uniqueness." -- Gilda Radner

item.title: Cody add a quote by Martha Graham
item.description: "There is a vitality, a life force, an energy, a quickening that is translated through you into action, and because there is only one of you in all time, this expression is unique. And if you block it, it will never exist through any other medium and will be lost." -- Martha Graham

item.title: Cody add a quote by Gloria Steinem
item.description: "The truth will set you free, but first it will piss you off." -- Gloria Steinem

item.title: Cody add a quote by Fellini
item.description: "There is no end. There is no beginning. There is only the infinite passion of life. " -- Fellini

item.title: Cody add a quote by Aung San Suu Kyi
item.description: "If you're feeling helpless, help someone. " -- Aung San Suu Kyi

item.title: Cody add a quote by Kahlil Gibran
item.description: "Out of suffering have emerged the strongest souls; the most massive characters are seared with scars." -- Kahlil Gibran
